title: Microwell-based Single-Cell RNA-seq

groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

request.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

source.description:
Live stain cells
Harvest and resuspend 500,000 cells in
(500 cells/uL).

Incubate the cells in 4 uM CalceinAM (4ul 1mM CalceinAM per ml cells) for
on ice.

Preparation of lysis buffer, and wash buffer, and fluorinated oil
While the cells are being live stained, make
(
+
)
(
+
).

Load buffers and fluorinated oil to reagent reservoirs
reagent reservoir 1:
reagent reservoir 4:
reagent reservoir 5:

Prepare mRNA-capture-beads
Gently vortex the beads, transfer
of beads into a microcentrifuge tube.

Wash the beads with
and resuspend the beads in
. Keep the beads on ice before use.

mRNA-capture-bead and cell loadings
Flush
through the wash buffer-filled device. Exercise caution to avoid flowing air into the device.

Load
into the TBS-flushed device. Fine tune the size of liquid puddles on both inlet and outlet of the device until the cells stop moving in the device. Let cells settle for
.

Flush
through the cell-loaded device. Flush gently so that the loaded cells don’t get washed out.
Confirm 5-10% of wells contain single cell under microscope.

Load
into the device. Reuse the beads to repeat the loading until >60% wells contain beads. Load gently so that the bead flow does not wash cells out.

Flush
through the cell-bead-loaded device. Flush gently so that the loaded cells and beads don’t get washed out.
Confirm >60% of wells contain mRNA-capture-bead under microscope.

Pre-run fluidics wash
Open channel 1 for
by executing the following command in the MinGW terminal: “Valvesonly_3_dual_3.exe 10000 1”.

Open channel 4 for
by executing the following command in the MinGW terminal: “Valvesonly_3_dual_3.exe 10000 4”.

Open channel 5 for
by executing the following command in the MinGW terminal: “Valvesonly_3_dual_3.exe 30000 5”.

Connect the device to the fluidics system and start the run
Plug the inflow (red) and outflow (green) tubing to the inlet and outlet of the device respectively. Make sure that the tubings are NOT inserted all the way to the bottom of the inlet or outlet as this can clog the device, which will prevent liquid from flowing through or flow at a significantly reduced flow rate.

Start the run by executing the following commend in the MinGW terminal: “SingleCellRNACapture_TCL_dual_large_array_3.exe”. Lysis buffer will be pushed through the device immediately followed by fluorinated oil, which will seal the wells, physically isolating the lysate of each individual cell.

The device will be heated to
to promote cell lysis and mRNA capture, and then cooled back to room temperature.

Cell lysis QC and mRNA capture
Once the device has been cooled to room temperature, disconnect the device from the fluidics system. Seal both inlet and outlet of the device with disc tapes.

Imaging the device under fluorescence microscope with a 10X objective. Check the distribution of lysate (traced by the live stain dye) in the device. You should see the fluorescent dye fill up the wells that had cells, and the absence of fluorescent dye in wells that did not have cell. If this is the case, unseal the inlet and outlet of the device, reconnect the device to the fluidics system, and proceed to the next step. Otherwise, abort the experiment.

Load all
to reagent reservoir 2 before mRNA capture step is completed.

Bead extraction
Assemble a syringe-tubing set: 2.5 cm green PEEK tubing and 1ml syringe connected with 12 cm tygon tubing.

Prepare
, keep on ice

“Massage” the device to dislodge the beads from the device, then flow
through the device with syringe-tubing set, COLLECT the overflow.

source.body: cDNA-coated beads will be washed out from the device with the buffer flow, so you want to collect the overflow.

source.description: Repeat step 26 until >95% of the beads have been removed from the device.

(10 mM Tris pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5% SDS)

.

(10 mM Tris pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA, 0.01% Tween-20) (2/2)

Wash fluidics system
Rinse and fill ALL reagent reservoirs (except reservoir 4) with DI water.
Execute the following command in the MinGW terminal: “SingleCellRNACapture_wash_dual_3.exe”

SMRT PCR product purification with 0.6X Ampure beads
Combine all SMRT PCR products into a single microcentrifuge tube.

Repeat Ampure bead purification steps (steps 65-70) with 1x volume Ampure bead (50 ul) and elute the Nextera library off Ampure beads with

Nextera library QC with Qubit and Bioanalyzer (follow vendor’s exact instructions).

Sequencing
Use custom read 1 sequencing primer.
Use 20% phix.
21 cycles on read 1.
63 cycles on read 2.
8 cycles on index read 1 (if multiple samples are pooled together).

description: (On-chip reverse transcription version, Sims Lab – Jinzhou Yuan and Yim L. Cheng) 7/6/2017
